subject: Psychology
title: Mirror Neurons and Empathy
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Mirror Neurons and Empathy.

hook.text: You watch someone stub their toe and wince as if it happened to you. Your brain simulated their pain.

buildup.text: Mirror neurons fire both when you perform an action and when you observe someone else performing it.

discovery.text: Discovered in monkeys by Rizzolatti in the 1990s, they may explain how we understand others' intentions.

twist.text: The mirror neuron theory of empathy is debated. Some scientists think the role is overstated in popular media.

climax.text: Whether mirror neurons are the full story or not, the brain clearly has systems for sharing others' feelings.

punchline.text: Your brain rehearses what it sees others feel.

quiz.question: What do mirror neurons do?
options: Fire both when you act and when you observe someone else act
